Package imagingbook.common.corners

Class SubpixelMaxInterpolator

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.common.corners.SubpixelMaxInterpolator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SubpixelMaxInterpolator.QuadraticLeastSquares, SubpixelMaxInterpolator.QuadraticTaylor, SubpixelMaxInterpolator.Quartic
    public abstract class SubpixelMaxInterpolator
extends Object

    Common interface for all sub-pixel maximum locator implementations. A sub-pixel maximum locator tries to interpolate the continuous position and value of a local maximum for a discrete 3x3 neighborhood. The center value in the discrete neighborhood is assumed to be a local maximum. See Sec. 6.5 and Appendix E of [1] for additional details.

    [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, Digital Image Processing – An Algorithmic Introduction, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).

    Version:
    2021/01/19, 2022/09/11 revised instance creation
    See Also:
    SubpixelMaxInterpolator.QuadraticTaylor, SubpixelMaxInterpolator.QuadraticLeastSquares, SubpixelMaxInterpolator.Quartic

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  SubpixelMaxInterpolator.Method
      Enumeration of different SubpixelMaxInterpolator methods.
      static class  SubpixelMaxInterpolator.QuadraticLeastSquares
      2D interpolator based on least-squares fitting a quadratic polynomial
      static class  SubpixelMaxInterpolator.QuadraticTaylor
      2D interpolator using second-order Taylor expansion to find the coefficients of the quadratic interpolating polynomial
      static class  SubpixelMaxInterpolator.Quartic
      2D interpolator based on fitting a 'quartic' (i.e., 4th-order) polynomial

    • Method Detail

      • getMax

        public abstract float[] getMax​(float[] s)
        Tries to locate the sub-pixel maximum from the 9 discrete sample values (s0,...,s8) taken from a 3x3 neighborhood, arranged in the following order: 
         s4 s3 s2
 s5 s0 s1
 s6 s7 s8
        The center value (s0) is associated with position (0,0).
        Parameters:
        s - a vector containing 9 sample values in the order described above
        Returns:
        a 3-element array [x,y,z], with the estimated maximum position (x,y) and the associated max. value (z). The position is relative to the center coordinate (0,0). null is returned if the maximum position could not be located.
